multiple_choice_question.text: What is the value of the C4-magic sum for the vertex labeling in Figure 1?
What is the value of the C4-magic sum for the edge labeling in Figure 1?
What is the value of the C4-supermagic sum for the combined labeling in Figure 1?
According to the labeling scheme described in the text, what is the relationship between the labels in adjacent squares in Figure 2?
choices: The labels in adjacent squares are identical.
The labels in one square are obtained by adding a constant to the labels in an adjacent square.
There is no consistent relationship between the labels in adjacent squares.
The labels in adjacent squares are all prime numbers.

multiple_choice_question.text: How does Figure 3 illustrate the concept of a Q3-magic vertex labeling?
choices: It shows that the sum of vertex labels in any Q3 subgraph is constant, regardless of its position within the grid.
It demonstrates how to construct a Q3-magic vertex labeling for a grid graph.
It emphasizes the importance of the parity (even/odd) of coordinate sums in the labeling scheme.
It provides a visual representation of the recursive nature of the labeling algorithm.

multiple_choice_question.text: What aspect of the edge labeling scheme is highlighted by comparing the top and bottom squares of the cube in Figure 4 to the corresponding square in Figure 6?
choices: The edge labels in Figure 4 are simply a shifted version of the edge labels in Figure 6.
The edge labels in Figure 4 incorporate the vertex labels from Figure 6, illustrating the connection between the two labeling schemes.
The edge labels in Figure 4 are derived solely from the edge labels in Figure 6.
There is no clear relationship between the edge labels in Figure 4 and the labels in Figure 6.
